page.title: 02LANDSCAPE & INDUSTRY A-IN-M
page.content:
Over the years the town centre of Ashton hasn't changed much, except from cobbles to tarmac, and horse and cart to modern transport.
The outlying areas which used to be rolling countryside have now sprouted up housing estates one of which we live on.
The longest motorway in Great Britain is the M6 which runs from Carlisle in the North to Birmingham in the Midlands, through Ashton.
The{main industry in Ashton}is {Cromptons}who manufacture hinges and general iron machinery although there are one or two trading estates growing here and there.
